A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
As a film\, specifically a film in 2017\, it is strong. The directing was great\, camera angles perfect\, CG was spot-on. I think the acting is what it is. Doesn't seem that actors get cast for their acting abilities - more that they fit the look / quota the production company wants or needs. For the acting alone\, I'm dropping a star. 

Plot holes exist in every sci-fi movie. I believe that's the "fi" part of sci-fi. You can always explain your way into or out of a plot hole in this genre. Also\, we tend to analyze movies WAY too much these days and express our opinions on a single film based on our emotional reactions to other films or previous films in the series.

We need to stop rating films the way we do. It's toxic. A simple example is rating a movie on ticket sales / popularity. Kubo and the Two Strings is a perfect example of that.
